reviews.review: Best game that valve ever made 10/10
really fun game, but I'm stuck at the elevator part.

An achievement in technology and writing, HL2E1 is a reminder of exactly why Valve is the king of FPS narrative campaigns. The story's progression, the levels, the intimate, human and believable relationship between Alyx and Gordon- these are all aspects and magnitudes only the total best of gaming have managed to as much as match. 

A brilliant, soulful tear-jerker that struggles with absolutely nothing.

[h1] 2 + 1 = 3 = Half-Life 3 Confirmed [/h1]

Hear me out, Half-Life 2 + Episode 1 = 2 + 1 = 3 which makes Half-Life 3.

More of the same from Half Life 2, still good, albeit a little shorter.

9/10
At least it's not blue shift!

Straight after Half-Life 2, and a bridge into Episode 2. Personally, I find this game the weakest out of the 3 but still a must-play for Half-Life fans (what a shocker)

This game does not feature Taiga Saejima

Half-Life 2 - Episode 1 is a direct sequel to Half-Life 2. While short (3 hours), Episode 1 picks up where Dr. Freeman left off - the explosion of the Dark Energy reactor at the Citadel. Rejoin past characters for another journey - to escape City 17. Definitely worth the $ and time. Highly recommend.

Liked the first game, and love the second one, but this one felt boring to me. Gameplay wise its still the same and gets very repetitive in a lot of moments of the game.
